com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.map

Class MapDisplay.Layer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.map.MapCanvas
      • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.map.MapDisplay.Layer
  • Enclosing class:
    MapDisplay

    public static class MapDisplay.Layer
extends MapCanvas
    A single layer in the Z-buffer of the virtual map

      • getBuffer

        public final byte[] getBuffer()
        Description copied from class: MapCanvas
        Gets the backing color data buffer for all the data in this canvas. This buffer is not guaranteed to be immutable. For an immutable buffer, use MapCanvas.readPixels() instead. This data is formatted in such a way that:
        • The first color in the array is pixel (0, 0)
        • Satisfies condition index = x + y * width
        • The size of the buffer equals (width * height)
        Specified by:
        getBuffer in class MapCanvas
        Returns:
        raw color byte buffer

      • next

        public MapDisplay.Layer next()
        Gets the layer that follows this one, creating a new layer if required. The next layer is higher in the z-buffer, meaning it overlaps this layer.
        Returns:
        next layer

      • previous

        public MapDisplay.Layer previous()
        Gets the layer that precedes this one, creating a new layer if required. The previous layer is lower in the z-buffer, meaning that this layer overlaps that one.
        Returns:
        previous layer

      • writePixelsFill

        public MapCanvas writePixelsFill(int x,
                                 int y,
                                 int w,
                                 int h,
                                 byte color)
        Description copied from class: MapCanvas
        Fills a rectangular area in this canvas with a single color. No color blending is performed and any original pixels are replaced. No depth buffering is performed, either.
        Overrides:
        writePixelsFill in class MapCanvas
        Parameters:
        x - - coordinate of the top-left corner of the area
        y - - coordinate of the top-left corner of the area
        w - - width of the area
        h - - height of the area
        color - to fill
        Returns:
        this canvas

      • writePixel

        public final void writePixel(int x,
                             int y,
                             byte color)
        Description copied from class: MapCanvas
        Updates the pixel color of a single pixel. No color blending or depth buffering logic is performed.
        Specified by:
        writePixel in class MapCanvas
        Parameters:
        x - - coordinate of the pixel
        y - - coordinate of the pixel
        color - to draw

      • readPixel

        public final byte readPixel(int x,
                            int y)
        Description copied from class: MapCanvas
        Reads the pixel color value of a single pixel
        Specified by:
        readPixel in class MapCanvas
        Parameters:
        x - - coordinate of the pixel
        y - - coordinate of the pixel
        Returns:
        color at this pixel, 0 for transparent

      • readPixels

        public byte[] readPixels(int x,
                         int y,
                         int w,
                         int h,
                         byte[] dst_buffer)
        Description copied from class: MapCanvas
        Reads the raw pixel color data for a particular area in this canvas. This is guaranteed to be a copy of the actual data. This data is formatted in such a way that:
        • The first color in the array is pixel (0, 0)
        • Satisfies condition index = x + y * width
        • The size of the buffer equals (width * height)
        Overrides:
        readPixels in class MapCanvas
        Parameters:
        x - - coordinate of the top-left corner of the area
        y - - coordinate of the top-left corner of the area
        w - - width of the area
        h - - height of the area
        dst_buffer - - buffer to write the pixels to
        Returns:
        dst_buffer input parameter
